title: Marinara Sauce
introduction: Marinara Sauce is a quintessential southern Italian sauce distinguished by its vibrant flavor, often enhanced by crushed garlic cloves. This quick-cooking sauce is a staple for pasta dishes like spaghetti, and it benefits from the addition of fresh herbs, particularly basil, at the end of the cooking time to preserve its fresh taste.
ingredients: 3 pounds fresh plum tomatoes, peeled, seeded, and chopped, or 1 (28-ounce) can imported Italian peeled tomatoes with their juice, passed through a food mill
4 fresh basil leaves, torn into bits
instructions: 1. Pour the oil into a medium saucepan. Add the garlic and red pepper. Cook over medium heat, turning the garlic once or twice until it is golden, about 5 minutes. Remove the garlic from the pan.
2. Add the tomatoes and salt to taste. Cook 20 minutes, stirring occasionally, or until the sauce is thickened.
3. Turn off the heat and stir in the basil. Serve hot. Can be made ahead and stored in a tightly sealed container in the refrigerator up to 5 days or in the freezer up to 2 months.
